advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;DICK SMITH ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>Price list close-up in Australian$:<br> Basic CAT computer X-7500 <b>$1195.00</b><br> Disk Drive X-7505 <b>$1495.00</b><br> Disk Controller X-7510 <b>$149.95</b><br> Emulator Cartridge X-7530 <b>$149.95</b><br> Dual Joysticks X-7520 <b>$49.95</b><br> RF Modulator X-7550 <b>$49.95</b><br> RS-232C Serial Adaptor X-7515 <b>$149.95</b><br> Printer Cable (Centronics) X-7540 <b>$844.95</b><br> Filer Utilities Disk with DOS & Manual X-7512 <b>$59.95</b><br> High resolution RVB monitor X-1193 <b>$995.00</b><br> RGB Cable X-7560 <b>$44.95</b><br> High Res. Green Monitor X-1220 <b>$395.00</b><

computer.description:
The Cat was a rebadged version of the Laser 3000, made in Hong-Kong. It was partially compatible with the Apple II computer in its basic version, but quite fully compatible when the Apple II emulator cartridge was inserted.
It ran Apple DOS 3.3 operating system or CP/M 2.2 with an optional Z80 card.
Thanks to Murray Moffatt for information and pictures.
computer.keyboard: Full stroke 81 keys with numeric keypad and 8 function keys
computer.name: Cat
computer.peripherals: 5.25 floppy disk drives, Apple II emulator cartridge
computer.ports: Tape recorder, Bus expansion, TV aerial, composite video, joystick, Parallel, Serial
computer.price: A$1195 (see price list in adverts section)
